conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas during the process from state C to state D.
The process from state C to state D is isochoric (constant volume) because the volume remains constant at V = 4 L.
The work done by a gas during an isochoric process is zero because V1 = V2, so W = 0.
Verify the pressure change: Pressure remains constant from PC = 0.75 x 10^5 Pa to PD = 0.75 x 10^5 Pa, confirming no work is done.
The work done externally by the gas from state C to state D is 0.
